content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2606.8 - Responsibilities of the project owner

State Regulations
(a) The project owner shall timely obtain all
necessary permits, licenses and certifications to operate the eligible project. The project owner shall comply with all terms and conditions of all such
permits, licenses and certificates, and operate the certified equipment in
compliance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws, rules, regulations and guidance for the useful life of the eligible project. (b) The project owner may be required to
obtain the corporation's prior written approval before moving off-site, selling
or otherwise conveying the facilities or equipment financed in whole or part
with State assistance, during the useful life of the project. (c) The project owner shall notify the
corporation in writing prior to any change in ownership of the facility or
equipment which has been financed, in whole or part, with State assistance. For
purposes of this Part, change in ownership shall include, without limitation, any asset sale of the project owner, or any change in the form or makeup of the
project owner, during the useful life of the project. (d) For the duration of the useful life of
the certified equipment or any facilities financed in whole or in part with

State assistance, the project owner shall notify the corporation in writing of
any material change in the information submitted to the corporation in
connection with the project owner's application for State assistance under this

Part, including, without limitation, any change in its address or telephone
number. (e) In addition to any
additional information necessary to properly evaluate a request for State
assistance, the project owner may be required to furnish to the corporation the
following: (1)

Federal tax employer
identification number or social security number (only if the project owner is a
sole proprietorship); (2)
the
project cost, the name of the equipment vendor or manufacturer, the model and
serial number of the certified equipment or specifications of the facilities
financed with State assistance; (3)
information and documentation regarding the lease or ownership of the certified
equipment or facilities financed with State assistance; (4)
information regarding other sources of
funding or financial assistance for the approved eligible project; and
(5)
authorization for the
corporation to access information regarding the credit, payment history and

State records of the project owner. Notes
